column1: STACK#A data structure that follows the Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) principle
column2: where elements are added or removed from one end called the "top" of the stack.

column1: QUEUE#A data structure that follows the First-In-First-Out (FIFO) principle
column2: where elements are added at one end called the "rear" and removed from the other end called the "front" of the queue.

column1: LIST#A collection of elements that can be of different types and are stored in a specific order. Lists allow for easy access
TREE#A hierarchical data structure consisting of nodes connected by edges. It has a root node at the top and child nodes branching out from it. Trees are used to represent hierarchical relationships.
HEAP#A specialized tree-based data structure that satisfies the heap property. It is commonly used to efficiently retrieve the maximum or minimum element from a collection.
ALGORITHM#A step-by-step procedure or a set of rules for solving a specific problem. Algorithms provide a clear sequence of instructions to solve problems efficiently.
COMPUTER#An electronic device capable of executing instructions
column3: and storing and processing data. Computers are used for various tasks such as data processing

column1: PSEUDOCODE#A high-level description of a program or algorithm that uses a mixture of natural language and programming language constructs. It helps in planning and understanding the logic of a solution without being tied to a specific programming language.
PYTHON#A popular high-level programming language known for its simplicity and readability. Python is widely used for various applications
JAVA#A widely adopted object-oriented programming language known for its platform independence. Java is used for building applications ranging from desktop software to enterprise-level systems.
PROGRAMMING#The process of writing instructions for a computer to perform a specific task. Programming involves designing algorithms
column4: and debugging to create software applications.

column1: HARDWARE#The physical components of a computer system

column3: and instructions that run on a computer system. It includes applications

column1: DATABASE#A structured collection of data organized and stored in a way that enables efficient retrieval
column3: and manipulation of the data. Databases are commonly used for storing and accessing large amounts of structured information.

column1: MICROPROCESSOR#A small electronic component or chip that acts as the "brain" of a computer or electronic device. It performs basic arithmetic
column3: and controls the flow of information within the device.

column1: NETWORK#A system that connects multiple computers or devices together to share information and resources. Networks can be local (LAN) within a limited area or global (WAN) spanning large distances
IDE#A software application that provides tools and features to assist in writing
column3: and debugging computer programs. IDEs typically include a code editor
column5: and other helpful features for software development.

column2: complexity refers to the measure of the resources (such as time
column4: or processing power) required to solve a problem or perform an operation. It helps assess the efficiency and difficulty of algorithms and systems
column5: and guides the design and analysis of software solutions.
